alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 06 at 4:42PM MDT until June 06 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms were producing heavy rain over the headwaters of Crow and Dry Creeks along the northern boundary of Fremont County near the Hot Springs County border. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following counties, extreme north central Fremont and extreme western Hot Springs. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes in the Crow Creek and Dry Creek drainages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Rainfall has been estimated between 0.75 and 1.5 inches in an hour with amounts of 1.5 to 2.5 inches in three hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of extreme north central Fremont and extreme western Hot Springs Counties.
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
